title: devboard
description: Devboard is a project management application built with Next.js 14, TypeScript, and Material UI (MUI), showcasing a modern pages-router architecture. It leverages React Query for efficient data fetching and state management, providing a robust foundation for building scalable and maintainable web applications with a focus on clean code and best practices.

title: Map-Visualisation
description: Map-Visualisation is a project focused on creating interactive map visualizations. This repository utilizes HTML for the front-end interface and Python for data processing and backend functionality (if any). It aims to provide a platform for visualizing geographic data and presenting it in a user-friendly and informative manner.

title: jovian
description: The jovian repository is a Python-based CRUD application built with Flask, providing a practical example of web development using a PostgreSQL database.  It utilizes HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting to create a functional project that demonstrates common development topics like data management, user interface design, and server-side logic with a focus on creating, reading, updating, and deleting data.

title: next-voting
description: next-voting is a project built using TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript for creating and managing online voting systems. This repository provides a flexible and extensible framework for implementing secure and verifiable voting mechanisms, focusing on [mention a specific feature or goal, e.g., usability, transparency, or scalability] as a core principle. The project aims to offer a practical solution for various voting scenarios, from small-scale polls to larger organizational elections.

title: ros-log-viewer
description: ros-log-viewer is a web-based tool for visualizing and analyzing ROS (Robot Operating System) log files. Built using JavaScript, Python, HTML, and CSS, this project provides a user-friendly interface for filtering, searching, and interpreting log data, ultimately aiding in debugging and understanding ROS-based systems.

title: sleep-debt-tracker
description: sleep-debt-tracker is a project built with TypeScript, JavaScript, CSS, and HTML designed to help users track and manage their sleep debt. This repository leverages modern web development technologies to provide a user-friendly interface for monitoring sleep patterns and promoting healthy sleep habits. The project showcases the use of TypeScript in a practical application.

title: next-idea-board
description: Next-idea-board is a project management tool built using TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, designed to help users brainstorm, organize, and track their ideas. This repository provides a visual and intuitive interface for managing projects, facilitating collaboration, and turning concepts into actionable plans. It offers a flexible and customizable solution for individuals and teams seeking to streamline their creative process and improve overall project workflow.

title: resume
description: This repository houses the source code for my resume, built using TeX for professional formatting and HTML for potential online display. It serves as a personal project to demonstrate my skills and experience in a clear and visually appealing manner, and falls under the broader topic of personal project development and presentation.

title: finance-with-python
description: This repository, built using Jupyter Notebook and Python, explores various finance-related topics through practical projects. It serves as a hands-on learning resource for applying Python to financial analysis, modeling, and data visualization. Expect to find code examples and tutorials covering concepts within the broader realm of finance.

title: NextJs-Dashboard
description: NextJs-Dashboard is a project showcasing a modern and responsive dashboard built with Next.js, leveraging the power of TypeScript for type safety, CSS for styling, and JavaScript for dynamic functionality. This repository provides a foundational structure and example components for creating data-driven dashboards and is intended as a learning resource and a starting point for new projects.

title: robofleet-dashboard
description: The robofleet-dashboard repository provides a web-based interface built with JavaScript, HTML, CSS, and Python for visualizing and interacting with data from the Robofleet robotics platform. This project offers a user-friendly way to monitor robot status, analyze sensor data, and control robot behavior, focusing on enhanced situational awareness and efficient fleet management within the overall Robofleet ecosystem.

title: dynamic-event-calendar
description: dynamic-event-calendar is a JavaScript, CSS, and HTML project focused on building a dynamic and interactive event calendar. This repository contains the code for creating a visually appealing and user-friendly calendar interface, enabling users to easily view, add, and manage events. The project explores techniques for dynamically rendering calendar elements and handling user interactions to create a seamless event scheduling experience.

title: iot-asset-tracking
description: iot-asset-tracking is a Next.js project built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript that leverages Supabase for backend services and Tailwind CSS for styling. This repository provides a framework for tracking IoT assets, demonstrating a full-stack implementation using modern web development technologies and best practices. It explores topics such as serverless functions, database interactions, and responsive UI design within the context of a real-world asset tracking application.

title: genietalks
description: GenieTalks is a project built with TypeScript, CSS, JavaScript, and HTML, leveraging Express.js and Vite.js to create an interactive application that utilizes the Gemini API. This repository explores the integration of AI with web development technologies and provides a practical example of building a modern web application with a focus on expressjs, gemini-api, typescript, and vitejs.

title: atg-world
description: The atg-world repository contains a project built using TypeScript, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS. This repository serves as a central location for all project-related code, assets, and documentation, focusing on the key topics within the project.
